name: idiosyncratically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves strange or unusual habits, ways of behaving, or features: In many theatres, the backstage spaces are cramped and idiosyncratically arranged to fit the space available. It has been described as one of the most idiosyncratically beautiful films ever made.
More examplesFewer examplesShe is warm and idiosyncratically funny, in a way that is quintessentially English.The space is filled with great art works which are displayed idiosyncratically, in often innovative ways.She is a respected and successful singer-songwriter with an idiosyncratically appealing voice.
